Title: Review of mobile games icons designs: A study based on graphic designer knowledge
Source title: 2016 1st International Conference on Game, Game Art, and Gamification, ICGGAG 2016
Affiliations: Visual Communication Design - School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Oscario, A., Visual Communication Design - School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Luzar, L.C., Visual Communication Design - School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: With over one hundred thousand games apps, it's important to make a mobile game app stand out. The most basic way to do it is grabbing people attention through the icon. It's the first thing people see in apps store. It represents the face of the game. The mobile game app icon must communicate the right impression and the right message. This research studies the top grossing mobile games apps icons designs. Analyzing their forms, contents, and contexts to understand how they are designed. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: content; context; design; form; mobile games apps icon
Index Keywords: Forming; content; context; Graphic designers; Mobile games; Research studies; Design

Authors: Oscario A., Sriherlambang B., Akbar A.
Title: Building a positive brand image through advertisement: Case study: Insurance advertising in comic strip format for children
Affiliations: School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Oscario, A., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sriherlambang, B., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Akbar, A., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Advertising is facing a very tough challenge when it has to communicate a product/brand that is perceived negative by its market. The positive product or brand image is crucial in influencing the target market perception in hope to create a new demand. Using a qualitative case study method, the research analyzed how a brand tries to build a positive image in its market’s mind through an advertisement. The research analyzed the uncommon communication strategy from an advertisement of an insurance product that is still perceived negative by Indonesian market. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
